result.execSummary:
The defendant Bret D. Alexander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DEF PRESENT W/ATTY HAMM - PLEA NO CONTEST TO CT 1 - FOUND GUILTY - SENTENCED TO TIME SERVED, 12 DAYS CREDIT - TO PAY COSTS, BOND TO BE APPLIED - PP $50/MONTH COMMENCING JANUARY 1, 2015 AND ON THE 1ST DAY OF EACH MONTH THEREAFTER
Letter received from Attorney Hamm to Judge Goodman dated November 18, 2014.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 18, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Schedule Plea/Sentencing.
for Pretrial Conference and Status (Not Guilty Plea Entered)

Defendant appears in person with Attorney Hamm.  Defendant waives reading.  Court advises of charges and penalties.  Defendant pleads Not Guilty.
Pretrial Conference- November 10, 2014 @ 1:30 p.m.
Status Conference- November 24, 2014 @ 3:00 p.m.

Defendant appears in person with Attorney Hamm.  Court gives the right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant waives the right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.
